categories.title: Hyperfy Development Updates and Technical Discussions

content.text: Hyperfy's Discord community has been actively discussing several technical features and implementations. The most prominent topic has been the new particle system, which allows for various visual effects like explosions and auras. Developers have been sharing code snippets and troubleshooting implementation issues, particularly around attaching particles to avatars, bones, and skinned meshes. The proper implementation involves using `getBoneTransform` and positioning via `world.add(particles)` instead of `app.add(particles)`.

Other significant technical discussions included LiveKit integration for voice chat and screen sharing, billboard interaction fixes for UI nodes, multiplayer architecture with client/server code separation, and chain-agnostic wallet integration capabilities. Performance metrics were also shared, with reports of 1-2ms rendering times on RTX 4070.

The community has also been discussing mobile functionality, with positive feedback about Hyperfy's mobile experience. Questions were raised about whether build mode is available on mobile. Additionally, there's interest in integrating an AI MCP (Master Control Program) narrative into Hyperfy, with mentions that some developers have already experimented with this integration.

Several feature requests emerged from these discussions, including text chat channels, sprite animation for UI elements, NPC implementation for chat interactions, displaying external data like charts on screens, and exposing environment settings in world configuration for hosted worlds.
